div.p: Many ideas in this review were developed in the course of implementation of the research program “Social-ecological resilience on different spatial and temporal scales (emphasis on the coast)”, which was funded by the Emerging Interdisciplinary Research (EIDR) initiative of the Office of the Vice-President for Academic Affairs, University of the Philippines (OVPAA-EIDR Code 1-005-121113) and which took place in the municipality of Abra de Ilog, province of Occidental Mindoro, the Philippines. The field assistance of Fidel Silan, Michaela Webb, Raymond Dizon, and members of the international organization Ecotone Resilience and the full support of the local government headed by Eric and Meg Constantino are gratefully acknowledged. This is Marine Science Institute contribution number 455.
